instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 short on pbus_g3h & ppvbat_g3h_conn with solid green light
threads.message:
hello I need some help. I'm stuck and need some guidance. I got this 820-2915 that came in with fainted green light at MagSafe. It had a short on PP3V42_G3H & PPBUS_G3H. I was able to relieve the short on PP3V42_G3H by removing ISL6259. Now I have solid green light but I still have a short on PPBUS_G3H and PPBAT_G3H_CONN. Please note that I still haven't switched isl6259. I tried to inject some voltage but I wasn't able to find a component that gets hot. Any suggestions?

Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 short on pbus_g3h & ppvbat_g3h_conn with solid green light
threads.message: Remove F7040 and check in which side es the short pin 1 or pin2....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915 short on pbus_g3h & ppvbat_g3h_conn with solid green light
threads.message: I removed F7040 but i still had a short on both pads. I figured the short was on the system side of PPBUS_G3H. I injected some voltage into this pad and found a bad mosfet Q7550. After replacing this and isl6259 i have a working macbook. Please mark this as solved. Thanks!
